applicationempowering users to discover workout exercises tailored to specific body parts and equipment preferences • Leveraged the React frameworkto design the search engine, enriching the user experience with seamless interactivity and responsiveness • Integrated ExerciseDB and Youtube APIto showcase 2D instructional animation and tutorial videos for the requested exercises
token_id2.jobDescription: Responsibilities: Design, develop, and test software applications using modern technologies and methodologies. Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other engineers to define and implement product features. Identify and resolve technical issues, ensuring optimal performance and reliability. Mentor junior team members and promote best practices. Stay up-to-date with the latest technological advancements and industry trends. Contribute to the overall technical direction of the company. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 5+ years of experience in software development. Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or JavaScript. Experience with frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue.js. Solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and design patterns. Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP). Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills. Strong communication and teamwork abilities.

eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ.jobDescription: Lead the design, development, and implementation of scalable software systems for planetary navigation and interstellar communication. Collaborate with cross-functional teams including astronauts, astrophysicists, and AI researchers to deliver high-quality solutions that push the boundaries of space exploration. Write clean, maintainable code that will withstand the test of time (or at least the vacuum of space). Participate in code reviews and mentor junior engineers, helping them develop their coding skills to infinity and beyond. Contribute to our open-source projects, including the creation of a universal software framework for Mars rovers and space station management. Create and maintain detailed technical documentation to support interplanetary development standards. Debug and optimize code to achieve minimal latency in real-time space communications, even when signals are transmitted from across the Milky Way. Stay ahead of emerging technologies and contribute to innovative concepts that could shape the future of space exploration. Required Skills and Qualifications: Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Astrophysics, or a related field. Master's or PhD is a bonus if you’ve also built a working teleportation device. Minimum 5 years of professional software development experience (preferably with experience coding in a zero-gravity environment). Proficiency in at least two programming languages, such as Python, Java, C++, or QuantumScript (our proprietary language for quantum computing). Experience with cloud computing platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, or equivalent), and have an understanding of how to make code run in outer space. Expertise in building highly available and fault-tolerant distributed systems that can survive a solar flare or two. Deep understanding of algorithms, data structures, and interplanetary data transmission protocols. Excellent debugging skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues across multiple environments (terrestrial and extraterrestrial). Familiarity with space systems software like NASA’s Open MCT or SpaceX's FalconXOS (or equivalent). Strong communication skills—ability to convey technical concepts to astronauts, engineers, and AI assistants alike. Preferred Qualifications: Previous experience working on software that is currently in orbit or was built with Martian soil in mind. Knowledge of blockchain applications in space-based finance (MarsCoin, anyone?). A working knowledge of the Higgs Boson and its potential uses in computational algorithms. Contributions to space-related open-source projects or software recognized by space agencies or extraterrestrial life.

eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ.jobDescription: At HyperTech Innovations, we're reimagining the future of AI-driven products. With a diverse, global team of passionate engineers and thinkers, we work on cutting-edge technologies that empower businesses and transform industries. As a leader in the AI/ML space, we provide tailored solutions that scale, adapt, and evolve to meet the needs of tomorrow. We are now looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our Product Development team and drive innovation across our flagship platforms. Job Description: As a Senior Software Engineer at HyperTech Innovations, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and maintain high-performance software systems that power our AI products. You’ll be responsible for tackling complex engineering challenges, driving architectural decisions, and helping to guide junior engineers through technical challenges. If you are a passionate problem-solver with experience in building scalable, high-quality software, this is the role for you! Responsibilities: Lead the design, architecture, and implementation of new software features and tools. Collaborate with product managers and UX/UI teams to translate user needs into elegant software solutions. Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code in Python, Java, C++, and/or other modern languages. Ensure software meets industry best practices in terms of security, performance, and scalability. Conduct code reviews to maintain high-quality standards and mentor junior engineers. Troubleshoot complex issues, identify root causes, and devise creative solutions. Contribute to the development of AI/ML algorithms that power key features in our products. Stay up to date with emerging technologies and continuously suggest new tools, techniques, and methodologies to improve team performance. Qualifications: 5+ years of professional experience as a Software Engineer with a focus on backend systems and distributed architecture. Strong proficiency in Python, Java, or C++, with a deep understanding of object-oriented programming and design patterns. Experience with microservices, RESTful APIs, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Familiarity with modern CI/CD practices, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and version control (Git). Proven experience with AI/ML technologies and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) is a plus. Strong problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to debug complex systems and optimize performance. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams. BS in Computer Science or related field (Master's preferred).

eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ.jobDescription: Warehouse Associate (FBA Experience) Position Summary: As a Warehouse Associate with FBA experience, you will play a crucial role in our efficient operations. You'll be responsible for handling various aspects of warehouse tasks, including receiving, picking, packing, and shipping orders for Amazon Fulfillment Centers (FBA). Responsibilities: Receiving: Accurately receive and inspect incoming inventory, ensuring it meets quality standards. Picking: Efficiently pick products from our warehouse shelves based on customer orders, using RF scanners. Packing: Carefully pack orders according to FBA guidelines, ensuring they are secure for shipping. Shipping: Prepare orders for shipment to Amazon Fulfillment Centers, ensuring accurate labeling and documentation. Inventory Management: Maintain accurate inventory records and conduct regular cycle counts. Adhere to safety protocols: Follow all safety procedures and regulations to ensure a safe working environment. Qualifications: Previous experience working in a warehouse environment, particularly with FBA experience. Strong organizational and time management skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Attention to detail and accuracy. Physical fitness to handle lifting, bending, and standing for extended periods. Benefits: Competitive salary and benefits package Opportunities for growth and advancement Supportive and collaborative work environment If you are a dedicated and hardworking individual with a passion for e-commerce and a strong work ethic, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resume to Job Type: Full-time Pay: $18.00 - $21.00 per hour Benefits: Retirement plan Schedule: Monday to Friday Language: English (Preferred) Shift availability: Day Shift (Preferred) Ability to Commute: Fairfield, NJ 07004 (Required) Ability to Relocate: Fairfield, NJ 07004: Relocate before starting work (Preferred) Work Location: In person

eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ.extractTextFromPdf: TRUONG (RICHARD) DANG truongd1903@gmail.com | (862)–339–8461 | github.com/truongd3 | linkedin.com/in/2dt/ EDUCATION New Jersey Institute of Technology Newark, NJ Bachelor of Science in Computer Science Expected Graduation: May 2025 ● Overall GPA: 3.97 ● Awards: Google I/O, Dean’s List, NJIT Academic Scholar Award, Highlander Freshman Award ● Coursework: Data Structures & Algorithms, Object-oriented Programming, Web Development, Operating Systems, Linux Programming, Database Systems, Machine Learning, Cybersecurity, Computer Networks, Data Visualization WORK EXPERIENCE Tesla Fremont, CA Software Engineer Intern Jan – May 2025 ● Work on HTTP, DNS, backend APIs (Load Balancer, Akamai, Varnish, Netbox) in Python, JavaScript, and Golang. Justworks New York, NY Software Engineer Intern May – Aug 2024 ● Computed and processed payroll for 165,000+ companies and their employees using Ruby on Rails. ● Developed 105 modules in Customer Service Tools infrastructure for 444 Justworks engineers and 1M+ customers to monitor and maintain payroll transactions. ● Engineered a Payroll Stats page using ReactJS and Active Record ORM, providing 1,500+ Justworks employees with real-time payroll insights and reducing Computing Team 5% of PagerDuty alerts. ● Handled HTTP requests to retrieve 40 data categories from invoices per week by designing a Payroll Week API. ● Reduced data query execution time from 8 minutes to 30 seconds by SQL and Active Record query optimization. ● Reduced page loading time from 30 seconds to 1 second by implementing Low-Level Caching technique in Rails. New Jersey Institute of Technology Newark, NJ Linux Programming Teacher Assistant Jan 2024 – Present ● Worked as a teaching assistant in Linux Programming course to teach 100+ students Linux, Shell (Bash), and C. ● Graded 50+ homework submissions per week and helped students optimize coding time and memory complexity. ● Achieved the highest final grade average (51%) out of 7 sections in my cohort. Westlock Controls Saddle Brook, NJ Software Engineer Intern May – Aug 2023 ● Transmitted 1200+ data points from accelerometer to AWS S3 Bucket and IoT Core via MQTT protocol in C/C++. ● Detected 18+ abnormal vibrations from valve systems per monitoring by implementing the Random Cut Forest algorithm in Python on AWS SageMaker, replacing the Mahalanobis Distance algorithm. ● Increased Westlock software application accuracy by 50%, preparing for the launch of a new sensor device. OPEN-SOURCE PROJECTS AI-Powered Restaurant Assistant - Backend Developer ● Developed a Claude-3 AI-driven assistant in Python for restaurant customer support on Amazon Bedrock. ● Integrated a Knowledge Base of 54 meals from 3 menus with Amazon OpenSearch Serverless and created an Action Group to manage 9+ table bookings. Public Key Cryptography - Backend Developer ● Secured transformation over 159,197 integers using the Rivest-Shamir-Adleman Encryption algorithm. ● Achieved 100% accuracy rate by handling number overflow issues in C++. Private Chat Socket - Fullstack Developer ● Built a Vue.js chat app using JavaScript and WebSocket, enabling real-time communication between 2+ clients. ● Integrated Redis to scale up to 1,000 servers and improved load balancing. LEADERSHIP Google Developer Student Club New Jersey Institute of Technology President Apr 2022 – July 2024 ● Selected as 1 of 80 Presidents (from 200+ applicants) in North America to attend Google I/O 2024. ● Hosted 19 workshops for 60+ attendees on average by collaborating with Google, Bank of America, Prudential, JPMorgan Chase & Co, Johnson & Johnson, and Guardian Life engineers. ● Presented 10+ technical workshops: “C++ and Arduino”, “Wordle in Python”, “LeetCode Session”, etc. AWARDS / CERTIFICATES ● Google I/O (2024) | 1st Prize at International Collegiate Programming Contest Qualifier (ICPC) (2022 & 2023) ● Silver Honor at International Youth Math Challenge (IYMC) (2021) | Silver Medal at Singapore & Asian Schools Math Olympiad (SASMO) (2018) | 1st Prize (Top 10/400) in Math at City-wide Merit Competition (2017) SKILLS ● Languages: Python, C/C++, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Golang, Java, Bash, HTML/CSS, GraphQL, Ruby, Swift ● Frameworks: React, RESTful APIs, MySQL, JAX, Node.js, Next.js, Flask, WebSocket, MongoDB ● Tools: AWS, IBM Cloud, Git (GitHub), NumPy, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Google Analytics, Docker, Redis
eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ.jobDescription: This will be your network and it is constantly growing. Your primary function will be to ensure that the network is reliable, robust and can scale to meet the challenges that serving over a billion users presents. Automation and continuous improvement are the keys to meeting our demands; you will be responsible for developing and deploying network designs, automation systems and network performance improvements into our production network. Do you feel that you can do more than what your network's growth allows? Do you want to solve problems that can only be seen in large scale environments? Do you want to work on one of the most dynamic, fast-paced networks in the world? Do you want to help in our mission to make the world more open and connected? Then this is the role for you! Network Production Engineer (University Grad) Responsibilities Build experience with Backbone, Data Center, and Network Infrastructure Engineering teams through rotational experiences during your first year Build, manage and maintain multi-vendor, multi-protocol data center and backbone networks Develop optimized network monitoring systems Design, and deploy new network architectures Develop automated methods to mitigate and remediate network events Analyze data to diagnose and identify root causes to network issues Be an active participant in deep technical discussions Develop and maintain consistency within the network infrastructure Minimum Qualifications Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta. Experience with computer networks Experience with UNIX, TCP/IP, network fundamentals, or similar Experience coding in at least one language (Python / Golang / Rust / C++ are all in use) Experience learning new concepts around network design and management Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of Switching and Routing concepts and implementation Knowledge of routing protocols BGP, OSPF and ISIS Knowledge of tunneling protocols MPLS, GRE, IPnIP

eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ.extractTextFromPdf: TRUONG (RICHARD) DANG truongd1903@gmail.com | (862)–339–8461 | github.com/truongd3 | linkedin.com/in/2dt/ EDUCATION New Jersey Institute of Technology Newark, NJ Bachelor of Science in Computer Science Expected Graduation: May 2025 ● Overall GPA: 3.97 ● Awards: Google I/O, Dean’s List, NJIT Academic Scholar Award, Highlander Freshman Award ● Coursework: Data Structures & Algorithms, Object-oriented Programming, Web Development, Operating Systems, Linux Programming, Database Systems, Machine Learning, Cybersecurity, Computer Networks, Data Visualization WORK EXPERIENCE Tesla Fremont, CA Software Engineer Intern Jan – May 2025 ● Work on HTTP, DNS, backend APIs (Load Balancer, Akamai, Varnish, Netbox) in Python, JavaScript, and Golang. Justworks New York, NY Software Engineer Intern May – Aug 2024 ● Computed and processed payroll for 165,000+ companies and their employees using Ruby on Rails. ● Developed 105 modules in Customer Service Tools infrastructure for 444 Justworks engineers and 1M+ customers to monitor and maintain payroll transactions. ● Engineered a Payroll Stats page using ReactJS and Active Record ORM, providing 1,500+ Justworks employees with real-time payroll insights and reducing Computing Team 5% of PagerDuty alerts. ● Handled HTTP requests to retrieve 40 data categories from invoices per week by designing a Payroll Week API. ● Reduced data query execution time from 8 minutes to 30 seconds by SQL and Active Record query optimization. ● Reduced page loading time from 30 seconds to 1 second by implementing Low-Level Caching technique in Rails. New Jersey Institute of Technology Newark, NJ Linux Programming Teacher Assistant Jan 2024 – Present ● Worked as a teaching assistant in Linux Programming course to teach 100+ students Linux, Shell (Bash), and C. ● Graded 50+ homework submissions per week and helped students optimize coding time and memory complexity. ● Achieved the highest final grade average (51%) out of 7 sections in my cohort. Westlock Controls Saddle Brook, NJ Software Engineer Intern May – Aug 2023 ● Transmitted 1200+ data points from accelerometer to AWS S3 Bucket and IoT Core via MQTT protocol in C/C++. ● Detected 18+ abnormal vibrations from valve systems per monitoring by implementing the Random Cut Forest algorithm in Python on AWS SageMaker, replacing the Mahalanobis Distance algorithm. ● Increased Westlock software application accuracy by 50%, preparing for the launch of a new sensor device. OPEN-SOURCE PROJECTS AI-Powered Restaurant Assistant - Backend Developer ● Developed a Claude-3 AI-driven assistant in Python for restaurant customer support on Amazon Bedrock. ● Integrated a Knowledge Base of 54 meals from 3 menus with Amazon OpenSearch Serverless and created an Action Group to manage 9+ table bookings. Public Key Cryptography - Backend Developer ● Secured transformation over 159,197 integers using the Rivest-Shamir-Adleman Encryption algorithm. ● Achieved 100% accuracy rate by handling number overflow issues in C++. Private Chat Socket - Fullstack Developer ● Built a Vue.js chat app using JavaScript and WebSocket, enabling real-time communication between 2+ clients. ● Integrated Redis to scale up to 1,000 servers and improved load balancing. LEADERSHIP Google Developer Student Club New Jersey Institute of Technology President Apr 2022 – July 2024 ● Selected as 1 of 80 Presidents (from 200+ applicants) in North America to attend Google I/O 2024. ● Hosted 19 workshops for 60+ attendees on average by collaborating with Google, Bank of America, Prudential, JPMorgan Chase & Co, Johnson & Johnson, and Guardian Life engineers. ● Presented 10+ technical workshops: “C++ and Arduino”, “Wordle in Python”, “LeetCode Session”, etc. AWARDS / CERTIFICATES ● Google I/O (2024) | 1st Prize at International Collegiate Programming Contest Qualifier (ICPC) (2022 & 2023) ● Silver Honor at International Youth Math Challenge (IYMC) (2021) | Silver Medal at Singapore & Asian Schools Math Olympiad (SASMO) (2018) | 1st Prize (Top 10/400) in Math at City-wide Merit Competition (2017) SKILLS ● Languages: Python, C/C++, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Golang, Java, Bash, HTML/CSS, GraphQL, Ruby, Swift ● Frameworks: React, RESTful APIs, MySQL, JAX, Node.js, Next.js, Flask, WebSocket, MongoDB ● Tools: AWS, IBM Cloud, Git (GitHub), NumPy, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Google Analytics, Docker, Redis
eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ.jobDescription: This will be your network and it is constantly growing. Your primary function will be to ensure that the network is reliable, robust and can scale to meet the challenges that serving over a billion users presents. Automation and continuous improvement are the keys to meeting our demands; you will be responsible for developing and deploying network designs, automation systems and network performance improvements into our production network. Do you feel that you can do more than what your network's growth allows? Do you want to solve problems that can only be seen in large scale environments? Do you want to work on one of the most dynamic, fast-paced networks in the world? Do you want to help in our mission to make the world more open and connected? Then this is the role for you! Network Production Engineer (University Grad) Responsibilities Build experience with Backbone, Data Center, and Network Infrastructure Engineering teams through rotational experiences during your first year Build, manage and maintain multi-vendor, multi-protocol data center and backbone networks Develop optimized network monitoring systems Design, and deploy new network architectures Develop automated methods to mitigate and remediate network events Analyze data to diagnose and identify root causes to network issues Be an active participant in deep technical discussions Develop and maintain consistency within the network infrastructure Minimum Qualifications Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta. Experience with computer networks Experience with UNIX, TCP/IP, network fundamentals, or similar Experience coding in at least one language (Python / Golang / Rust / C++ are all in use) Experience learning new concepts around network design and management Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of Switching and Routing concepts and implementation Knowledge of routing protocols BGP, OSPF and ISIS Knowledge of tunneling protocols MPLS, GRE, IPnIP
